Job Title: Bar Supervisor-Beverage 1

Location: New Orleans, LA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Summary

The Bar Supervisor helps to make the bar a comfortable and suitable place for customers by ensuring that all facilities and services are perfectly provided. He/She assists the bar manager in managing the bar. Prepares and serves alcoholic or non-alcoholic beverages to customers or guests.

Qualifications

 Responsibilities 

A high school diploma with considerable work experience in bars is sufficient for small bars.For big bars a college degree preferably hotel management degree is essential.A good knowledge about working and operations of the barA pleasing personalityExcellent communication and leadership skillsGood customer service ethicsThorough knowledge regarding state specifications for running a barWork hours are inconsistent and hence must be able to work odd hours

Job Responsibilities

Greets guests takes orders or makes recommendations and prepares and serves beverages.Stocks the bar with drinks garnishes and glassware and ensures a clean working environment.Ensures compliance with federal and state liquor laws and applicable company policies. May assist with inventory.Ensuring that the staff such as bar tenders and waiters are well trained in their jobsMaintain standards of the bar as per state regulationsMaking training arrangement for new staffEnsure safety measures of the barDeal with customers in times of trouble and ensure that order prevailsInvolving in advertising and publicity campaigns to ensure an increased customer base for the baseMeet with suppliers and ensure prompt delivery of bar essentialsPlanning means of improving the ambiance of the spaceKeep track of daily income and expense of the barMake regular reports to the bar manager and fulfill manager's responsibilities when the manager is absent

Company Overview

As the global leader in third-party hotel management, our growing portfolio represents over 1,550 hotels in all 50 states and 22 countries, from top international lodging brands to luxury hotels, destination resorts and lifestyle hotels. Our associates around the globe are passionate about serving our guests and driving exceptional results, and thrive in a culture where everyone is inspired to be the best. Join a world of possibility with Aimbridge Hospitality.

Benefits

After an initial waiting period, those hired into full time positions are eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes the following:

 Now offering Daily Pay! Ask your Recruiter for more details  Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage  Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Income  Term Life and AD&D Insurance  Paid Time Off  Employee Assistance Program  401k Retirement Plan

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
